SENT.plain: The diagnosis of the anterior spinal artery syndrome can be reached with fair certainly by thorough clinical examination and knowledge of the underlying neuroanatomy
Sudden onset of para- or quadripareses, and dissociated sensory loss are the headmarks
Seven cases are reported who all had this diagnosis
The etiology is discussed with special reference to the possibility of a traumatic origin
The prognosis is variable, in spite of considerable initial impairment restitution in certain cases can be very good
